item.description:
Meet @ 10:30am @ Traip Academy Boat Ramp

We'll ride the outgoing tide through Kittery Point harbor, past 3 old forts, and two lighthouses, continuing out to Wood Island for a stop and a snack and a walk around the abandoned coast guard station.  While there, I will use all of my special meetup super powers to reverse the direction of the mighty Piscataqua River waters so that we can paddle back upriver with ease!  We'll be out for 3 or 4 hours, see some great views, breathe fresh air, and have a great time.

Afterward we'll head over to the outdoor garden at the Gaslight for food and drinks.  They usually have live music.

The Piscataqua River has boat traffic and current.  Kayaks of 12 feet or longer are recommended.  Bring a spray skirt if you have one.  PFDs are required.

One rental sea kayak is available.  Email Larry for info.

DIRECTIONS: I-95 Maine exit #3/Rt 236. From Kittery traffic circle (Dairy Queen) take Route 236 South to a right turn on Route 103 West. Left turn to Williams Ave.   Traip Academy is Kittery's public high school.  There's plenty of free parking at this location.

 

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing.  Fee is for meetup site expenses, planning, and launch fees where applicable.  This is not a guided tour.   -Larry Pilla
item.name: Kittery Point Island, Fort, & Lighthouse Kayak Tour!
